content.raw: Should we have a check here for `tx.size() >= 2`?
content.html: Should we have a check here for tx.size() >= 2?

content.raw: It is not possible to triangulate these files, since they have shapes that overlap. But instead of crashing, Gazebo should report an error. I will investigate.
content.html: It is not possible to triangulate these files, since they have shapes that overlap. But instead of crashing, Gazebo should report an error. I will investigate.

content.raw: This looks good to me. Only found a crash but I think it's unrelated to this PR.
content.html: This looks good to me. Only found a crash but I think it's unrelated to this PR.

content.raw:
The skew seems to be parsed correctly:

![svg4.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/1066328610-svg4.png)

As a reference, this is how it is parsed on default:

![svg3.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/1219214780-svg3.png)

But this file pointed out another problem when trying to extrude it. Gazebo crashes:

The skew seems to be parsed correctly:

As a reference, this is how it is parsed on default:

But this file pointed out another problem when trying to extrude it. Gazebo crashes:

update.description:
Added support for the "transform" attribute on a "path" element
For a future PR: transform attribute on a group "g" element, and <transform-list>

Thank you for your review :-)
update.title: Svg_path_transformations

content.raw: Actually, now that I think about it, this code path is impossible (if the xml attribute "transform" is set in the svg file, it cannot be an empty string). I have replaced it with a an assertion (GZ_ASSERT)
content.html: Actually, now that I think about it, this code path is impossible (if the xml attribute "transform" is set in the svg file, it cannot be an empty string). I have replaced it with a an assertion (GZ_ASSERT)

content.raw: Thank you, it is fixed now.

Well, that is not quite true: a list of affine transformation 3x3 matrices (M1, M2, M3... Mn) can be expressed as a single 3x3 matrix M = M3 *M2 *M1. You can see something like this in the implementation of rotation (translation * rotation * translation).
However, when I get around to support multiple transfromations (the parsing assumes a single one for now), I can put these matrices in a list. This might be easier to debug if there is a problem.
content.html: Well, that is not quite true: a list of affine transformation 3x3 matrices (M1, M2, M3... Mn) can be expressed as a single 3x3 matrix M = M3 M2 M1. You can see something like this in the implementation of rotation (translation * rotation * translation). However, when I get around to support multiple transfromations (the parsing assumes a single one for now), I can put these matrices in a list. This might be easier to debug if there is a problem.

content.raw: It can't be a list anymore, right?
content.html: It can't be a list anymore, right?

content.raw: Also check the number of elements in `numbers`?
content.html: Also check the number of elements in numbers?
